summary: This document consists of email correspondence among Deutsche Bank employees discussing the continuation of their relationship with Jeffrey Epstein amidst negative media coverage and a recently withdrawn lawsuit. The emails indicate that the lawsuit was deemed frivolous and that the bank's compliance team was comfortable proceeding based on prior assessments.

persons.name: Mayur Rathod
persons.context: Mayur Rathod is involved in the discussions regarding the Epstein relationship and compliance matters.

persons.name: Yoonsun Chung
persons.context: Yoonsun Chung is part of the compliance team at Deutsche Bank and is involved in the discussions about the Epstein case.

persons.name: Kimberly Hart
persons.context: Kimberly Hart is a key decision-maker in the discussions about the Epstein relationship and compliance issues.

persons.name: Andrew Gallivan
persons.context: Andrew Gallivan approves the continuation of the relationship with Epstein based on previous assessments.

persons.name: Stewart Oldfield
persons.context: Stewart Oldfield is involved in the discussions regarding the Epstein case and compliance reviews.

persons.name: Richard Larossi
persons.context: Richard Larossi is involved in the compliance discussions and requests approval to move forward with KYC remediation related to Epstein.

connections.description: Kimberly Hart and Andrew Gallivan work together at Deutsche Bank, discussing compliance and risk management regarding Epstein.
Mayur Rathod and Yoonsun Chung are both Vice Presidents at Deutsche Bank and collaborate on compliance matters.
Richard Larossi reports to Kimberly Hart and is involved in compliance discussions regarding Epstein.
Stewart Oldfield communicates with Andrew Gallivan regarding the business risk associated with Epstein.

events.title: Notice of Dismissal
events.description: A notice indicating the dismissal of a lawsuit against Epstein, which was deemed frivolous.

events.title: Email Discussion on Epstein Relationship
events.description: Deutsche Bank employees discuss the continuation of their relationship with Epstein amidst negative media coverage.

locations: 60 Wall Street, New York, NY, USA
keyFacts: The lawsuit against Epstein was quickly withdrawn and deemed frivolous.
Steven Hoffenberg, who was behind the lawsuit, has a history of being described as unstable and has been convicted of fraud.
Deutsche Bank's compliance team was comfortable proceeding with the Epstein relationship based on previous assessments.
The correspondence indicates ongoing internal discussions about risk management related to Epstein.
Multiple Deutsche Bank employees are involved in the decision-making process regarding Epstein's account.
